forum.name: Equitable Teaching Practices
forum.intro:
As discussed in Session 1.5, equitable teaching practices can foster positive mathematics identities and give students greater agency, thereby improving learners’ mathematics education experiences and their outcomes.

In this activity, you will read about specific mathematics teaching practices that can promote equity and inclusion and consider how you do or might implement them in your teaching.

  1. Read the chapter Implementing Equitable Instruction from the book Catalyzing Change in High School Mathematics (NCTM, 2018, pp. 25–36).
  2. In the discussion forum below, identify one of the Mathematics Teaching Practices in Figure 2 from the chapter (i.e., the crosswalk between the Mathematics Teaching Practices and equitable teaching practices). Describe how you might implement that practice equitably in a lesson for adult mathematics learners. Click ADD DISCUSSION TOPIC to add a post to the forum. Be specific and provide examples.
